g.text: different types of interactions and different shapes of inclusions. Such research has been conducted
The results presented in this manuscript show that relatively small changes of sizes of selected
particles forming nanoinclusions can constitute an efﬁcient method to modify the elastic properties of
nanocomposites at high pressures. Even though only hard interactions were considered in the studied
system, the obtained results may be useful to researchers in the ﬁeld of materials engineering and
smart materials. The authors hope that some of the results presented here will constitute a source of
Conceptualization, J.W.N. and K.W.W.; Data curation, J.W.N.; Formal analysis,
J.W.N. and K.W.W.; Funding acquisition, K.W.W.; Investigation, J.W.N.; Methodology, J.W.N. and K.W.W.;

Visualization, J.W.N.; Writing—original draft, J.W.N.; Writing—review & editing , J.W.N. and K.W.W.
This work was supported by the grant No. 2017/27/B/ST3/02955 of the National Science Centre, Poland.
Center (PCSS). We are grateful to Mikołaj Kowalik for reading the manuscript and helpful comments.
The authors declare no conﬂict of interest. The funders had no role in the design of the
study; in the collection, analyses, or interpretation of data; in the writing of the manuscript, or in the decision to
